backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the Concept Delta app, handling user profile management, test creation/submission, and result storage with role-based access control and blob storage mixins.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting a single fix requirement: making the 'Submit Test?' confirmation dialog in TestPage.tsx use solid opaque backgrounds instead of transparent ones.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON-formatted summaries of all frontend source files, describing each file's purpose, styling approach, and key implementation details for the Concept Delta app.
frontend/index.css: Base Tailwind CSS file defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark mode color tokens used throughout the app.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point for the Vite/React app, mounting the React root and loading the main TypeScript module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that sets up TanStack Router with all app routes and conditionally renders the ProfileSetupModal for first-time authenticated users.
frontend/src/components/admin/QuestionGa: Admin panel component for uploading question images with a correct-answer selector and displaying/deleting existing questions, with upload progress tracking.
frontend/src/components/admin/ResultsTab: Admin tab that fetches and displays a table of all student test results, showing marks, score, percentage, and date by joining result data with test and user records.
frontend/src/components/admin/TestBuilde: Admin form for creating a new test by specifying a name, duration, marks configuration, and selecting questions from the existing question bank.
frontend/src/components/admin/TestManage: Admin table listing all tests with their status and a toggle switch to publish or unpublish each test via a mutation hook.
frontend/src/components/admin/UsersTab.t: Admin tab component that fetches and displays all registered users in a table with name, principal, class, and contact columns, with loading skeletons and an empty state.
frontend/src/components/AdminRoute.tsx: Route guard component that restricts access to admin-only pages, redirecting unauthenticated users to home, non-admins to dashboard, and admins who have already visited the admin panel back to dashboard with a toast.
frontend/src/components/Navbar.tsx: Sticky responsive navbar with Internet Identity login/logout buttons, conditional nav links based on auth and admin status, and a mobile hamburger menu.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: A modal dialog that collects new user profile information (name, class, contact number), validates inputs, and saves the profile via a mutation hook before navigating to the dashboard.
frontend/src/components/ProtectedRoute.t: A route guard component that redirects unauthenticated users to the home page and shows a loading spinner while the Internet Identity auth state is initializing.
frontend/src/components/TestCard.tsx: Displays a summary card for a single test (name, duration, question count) with a button that navigates to the test-taking route.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous ICP backend actor using React Query, invalidating dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useGetCallerUserProfi: Custom hook that fetches the current authenticated user's profile from the backend actor, gating the query on actor readiness and authentication state.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context and provider, exposing login/logout functions, identity state, and login status via a React context and custom hook.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Centralizes all React Query hooks for the app, covering user profiles, published tests, test submission, results, and admin operations like questions and user management.
frontend/src/hooks/useTestTimer.ts: Custom hook that implements a countdown timer for tests, tracking remaining seconds, expiry state, formatted time string, and completion percentage.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports Google Fonts, configures Tailwind CSS with custom CSS variables for light/dark themes, and defines utility classes for gradients and animations.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app wrapped with React Query's QueryClientProvider and the InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/AdminPage.tsx: Admin page component with tab-based navigation (questions, builder, management, users, results) that guards access by checking admin status and marks admin visits on mount.
frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx: Displays the student dashboard with a welcome banner, stats bar (available tests, total questions, total duration), and a grid of published test cards with loading skeletons.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Marketing landing page for the MHT-CET mock test platform, featuring a hero section, feature highlights, benefits list, and navigation CTAs for Telegram and YouTube.
frontend/src/pages/TestPage.tsx: Interactive test-taking page that renders questions with answer options, a countdown timer, progress bar, and a submit confirmation dialog that shows answered/unanswered counts before final submission.
frontend/src/pages/TestResultPage.tsx: Displays the test result after submission, showing score, percentage, and a breakdown of correct, wrong, and skipped answers for the most recent attempt.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility module providing functions to read, store, retrieve, and clear URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routes, with sessionStorage persistence support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the default theme with a custom navy color palette, Space Grotesk/Inter fonts, CSS-variable-based semantic colors, navy box shadows, and accordion/fadeIn animations.
project_state.json: Tracks the current state of the 'Concept Delta' MHT-CET test series web project at version 27, including architectural notes, existing features, and known issues such as broken score calculation and transparent backgrounds.
